review.body:
Second Down( First and Ten Book 2)

I love how Chase was so nervous about asking Ronnie to marry him. They both are so in love with each other.
I want to know how things turn out for them after they get Married.
All three girls are so cute. I can't wait to see what happens next.
What a romantic serie...

book.title: Una Tierra de Fuego (Libro #12 De El Anillo del Hechicero)

review.body:
Excelente

Una historia Ãºnica llena de misterios, magia y romance. No puedo esperar a ver que se fue en su siguiente entrega

Kat wants to move as far away from home as possible. Her relationship with her mother is horrible and her brother Drew tries to help her move out and go to college. When he comes with his friends to get her out, the sparks between Kat and Cole ignite.

Cole is being groomed to take over the Knight...

Nova Nova Nova

This is one grimey trick! I mean she did some shady crap from jumped, but what do expect from a true paper chasing ride or die trick! Get your because she is sure gonna get hers! Lol!

book.title: Greensmith Girls: Supernatural Witch Cozy Mystery (Lainswich Witches Series Book 1)

review.body:
Who done it?

I enjoyed reading this. Snappy patter and quick wits can get you out of anything, including ghostly revenge apparently. Should lead to some interesting sequels.
A fun, fluffy sci-fi with serious writing but a chaotic and fun plot. Passed along for others to enjoy.
I like tilly the best

book.title: Wet Cement: A Mix of Concrete Poems

review.body:
A witty tribute to the power and creativity of words, this collection of poems has a surprise on every page. Engaging, puzzling, and playful graphic design throughout make for a delightful read.

Reviewer 10.
It was a good short read. Inspiring although depressing...

book.title: Pleasured by You (Love in the City, #3)

review.body:
Fletcher and Bayler, two players who had a one night stand and now find themselves face to face again, with a new game neither knows how to play.

The sparks are as hot as before, yet neither wants to be the first to give in. Both wanting to keep to their current plan, when their âfriends with bene...
This is a charming series, set in Northern Ireland in the 1960s. It reminds me of the All Creatures series. The audio version makes a great driving companion.

A funny heroine and a cocky hero are the perfect recipe for a wonderful novel.

Sadie is witty and strong willed, West is cocky, and at times just drove me crazy with his aloofness. Their scenes were steamy, dramatic and completely captured my attention. The story is full of great secondary charact...

Delightfully charming and a glimpse into a world traversed by so few in the writing world. I found it quite enjoyable in so many ways. The plot was intriguing and mysterious, the characters uniquely fun, and the main character Charlotte a bundle of laughs as she tries to learn about proper ettiqu...

book.title: P.S. I Still Love You (To All the Boys I've Loved Before, #2)
book.publisher: Simon & Schuster Books for Young Readers

review.body: I actually thought it was better than the first book.

When I started the book, I was confused because it started out in a way that made me think it was a nonfiction self-help marriage relationship book. Once it started with the chapters, I quickly became engrossed and couldn't stop. I really liked the way each point of view was separated by headings...

To quote the great Julius Caesar: Veni, Vidi, Vici (I came, I saw, I conquer). For me, Carry On wasn't anything special and I felt let down because of all the hype that surrounded it. I want to talk about the plot first.

There was a lot of good moment in this book. I love the scenes between Simon...
Ehh... no.
